result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah Marie Martinson

records.addlTxt: DEF agrees to move forward, with no information filed.  State to file information, exact to criminal complaint.   Atty acknowledged receipt of information to be filed.  Moves to plea/sentencing.

Atty Gill indicates DEF  waives preliminary hearing.  Court advised the DEF as to her right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived her right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Moves to arraignment.

8:17 AM Defendant Sarah Marie Martinson appeared by video, in custody from Barron County Jail.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Sarah Marie Martinson.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.   Court gives recap from previous hearing.  Plea Questionnaire electronically submitted to Court.  Court addresses DEF regarding right to appear in person, DEF wishes to proceed by video today.   Court moves to waiver of preliminary of hearing and arraignment.   Court reviews the  information that is being processed,  DEF enters NC Plea to Count 1.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.   Court accepts plea to Count 1 and finds DEF guilty.  8:33 AM  OFF THE RECORD:  Attny Gill having technically difficulties, rebooting and logging back in.  8:34 AM  BACK ON THE RECORD:   Court reviews the plea colloquy.   Count 2 is dismissed.    Bond is revoked through sentencing.  Court orders long for PSI.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Sentencing hearing on December 12, 2022 at 10:15 am.

2:37 PM Defendant Sarah Marie Martinson appeared by video, in custody from Barron County Jail.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Sarah Marie Martinson.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Gill indicates hasn't been able to complete the plea questionnaire with DEF.   Discussion follows.    Court Reset.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 19, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

11:04 AM Defendant Sarah Marie Martinson appeared by video from the Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Sarah Marie Martinson. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court addresses DEF atty on procedure. DEF ATTY asks for a plea/sentencing hearing to be set.. Def Atty can appear by zoom.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

COMBINED BOND:  22CM114 & 22CF146

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
